title: Millions In Crisis As Coronavirus Relief Set To Expire At Years' End
description:
Lawmakers have been deadlocked for months on another coronavirus relief package. Now millions of Americans who have relied on emergency spending programs during the pandemic are about to see their benefits expire at the end of the year — unless Congress and the White House can agree to a spending deal before the holidays.

NPR correspondents Scott Horsley and Chris Arnold explain what could happen weeks from now if American workers, homeowners, renters and student loan borrowers lose key economic lifelines.

In participating regions, you'll also hear a local news segment that will help you make sense of what's going on in your community.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: Millions In Crisis As Coronavirus Relief Set To Expire At Years' End
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: On Tuesday a bipartisan group of lawmakers announced a short-term plan for pandemic relief. The big question is whether President Trump will support it.
itunes:subtitle: On Tuesday a bipartisan group of lawmakers announced a short-term plan for pandemic relief. The big question is whether President Trump will support it.
